    • Method Detail

      • delete

        public void delete(byte[] hashBytes)
        Description copied from interface: Enclave
        Deletes a particular transaction from the enclave Returns whether the desired state was achieved i.e. true if the message no longer exists, false if the message still exists

        Note that the method will return true if trying to delete a non-existant message, since the desired state of the message no longer existing is satisfied

        Specified by:
        delete in interface Enclave
        Parameters:
        hashBytes - The hash of the payload that should be deleted

      • receive

        public byte[] receive(byte[] key,
                      Optional<byte[]> to)
        Description copied from interface: Enclave
        Retrieves the message specified by the provided hash, and uses the provided key. If key is not provided, method will use the default public key, which is public key of the current node
        Specified by:
        receive in interface Enclave
        Parameters:
        key - The hash of payload to retrieve
        Returns:

      • store

        public MessageHash store(Optional<byte[]> sender,
                         byte[][] recipients,
                         byte[] message)
        Description copied from interface: Enclave
        Create an EncodedPayloadWithRecipients, then store this into the database, also publish the the payload to all recipients If sender public key is not provided, method will use default public key, which is public key of the current node
        Specified by:
        store in interface Enclave
        Parameters:
        sender - Public key of the sender
        recipients - List of recipients for this transaction
        Returns:
        The message hash returned after the transaction is persisted. This message hash can be used to retrieve the transaction.

        Description copied from interface: Enclave
        Publish the encoded payload to the specified recipient. This method will strip out irrelevant recipients and recipient boxes from the payload before sending. If the recipient
        Specified by:
        publishPayload in interface Enclave
        Parameters:
        encodedPayloadWithRecipients - Payload to send to recipient specified
        recipientKey - public key of the recipient to send payload to

      • resendAll

        Description copied from interface: Enclave

      • fetchTransactionForRecipient

        public EncodedPayloadWithRecipients fetchTransactionForRecipient(MessageHash hash,
                                                                 Key recipient)
        Description copied from interface: Enclave
        Fetch a transaction with the given hash The transaction should have originated from this node and the given key should appear in the recipients list
        Specified by:
        fetchTransactionForRecipient in interface Enclave
        Parameters:
        hash - the hash of the transaction to find
        recipient - the recipient of the transaction
        Returns:
        The payload that was originally distributed to the node that managed the recipient
